semantic_title: Sequencing Guidelines for Encounter for Treatment of Primary Malignancy
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > l. Sequencing of neoplasm codes > 1) Encounter for treatment of primary malignancy

content.full_text: If the reason for the encounter is for treatment of a primary malignancy, assign the malignancy as the principal/first-listed diagnosis. The primary site is to be sequenced first, followed by any metastatic sites. (Evidence: pg no: 37, L25-L28)
content.summary: Guidelines for sequencing codes when treating primary malignancy with metastases (Evidence: pg no: 37, L25-L28)
key_concepts: Primary malignancy as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 37, L26-L27)
Primary site sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 37, L27-L28)
Metastatic sites follow primary site (Evidence: pg no: 37, L28)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign the malignancy as the principal/first-listed diagnosis when encounter is for treatment of primary malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 37, L26-L27)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the primary purpose of the encounter is to treat the primary malignancy, that malignancy code takes precedence in sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 37, L25-L27)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The primary site is to be sequenced first, followed by any metastatic sites (Evidence: pg no: 37, L27-L28)
detailed_rules.explanation: Even when metastases are present, the primary site maintains sequencing priority when treatment is directed at the primary malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 37, L27-L28)
common_applications: Primary lung cancer with liver metastases
Primary breast cancer with bone metastases

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify that encounter is for treatment of primary malignancy
Step 2: Assign primary malignancy as principal/first-listed diagnosis
Step 4: Add any metastatic sites as additional diagnoses

usage_rules: Primary malignancy as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 37, L26-L27)
Metastatic sites follow primary site (Evidence: pg no: 37, L28)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient admitted for chemotherapy for primary lung cancer with liver metastases
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Admission for chemotherapy treatment of primary lung adenocarcinoma with hepatic metastases
step_by_step: Step 2: Assign primary lung cancer as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Add liver metastases as secondary diagnosis

correct_coding.sequencing: Primary site first, then metastatic sites
correct_coding.rationale: Treatment is directed at primary malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 37, L25-L28)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Liver metastases should not be principal when treating primary malignancy
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Sequencing metastatic site first when treatment is for primary malignancy

warnings: Do not sequence metastatic sites first when treating primary malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 37, L27-L28)
best_practices: Always identify the focus of treatment to determine sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 37, L25-L26)
common_mistakes: Sequencing metastatic sites before primary site when treating primary malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 37, L27-L28)
tips: Primary site always comes first when treating primary malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 37, L27-L28)
clinical_context: Applies to chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and surgical treatment of primary malignancies
